sections.title: References

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: The References section should be organized clearly with proper subheadings or numbering, especially when there are multiple references.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: References are clearly numbered and formatted with authors, titles, publication details, URLs, and citation counts.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section fully adheres to the requirement by providing precise and well-structured references, each with comprehensive details including DOIs and direct URLs.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: No overlaps with other sections detected.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: The references section is a standard part of article structure, enhancing the credibility of the article.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: All references are systematically listed at the end, following academic standards.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Complete adherence as it effectively provides all necessary references supporting the article's content.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: No overlap, function specific to references.

sections.meta_notes: The References section is comprehensive, well-organized, and supports the credibility of the article with directly accessible URLs.
